de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics.simulationarea

Class CanvasMouseListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics.simulationarea.CanvasMouseListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener

    public class CanvasMouseListener
extends Object
implements org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
    The listener that governs what happens when clicking around on the GUI's canvas.
    Author:
    Miquel Martin

      Create the mouse listener for the canvas.

    • Method Detail

      • mouseDown

        public void mouseDown(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e)
        What to do when the mouse button is pressed. Nothing.
        Specified by:
        mouseDown in interface org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event that triggered this method

      • mouseDoubleClick

        public void mouseDoubleClick(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e)
        What to do when a double click occurs. We make the selected agent move over to the clicked place.
        Specified by:
        mouseDoubleClick in interface org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event that triggered this method

      • mouseUp

        public void mouseUp(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e)
        What to do when the mouse button is released. This depends on the button:
        • Pressing the left mouse button selects an agent near the pointer, and has no effect if the agent is already selected
        • Pressing the right menu brings up the context menu to choose the agent or move the selected one to the clicked point
        Specified by:
        mouseUp in interface org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event that triggered this method
